built-with-ai.title: Built with AI: A High-Speed Engineering Case Study
built-with-ai.author: Fintricity Architect
built-with-ai.description: This website is more than just a landing page—it is a testament to the speed and precision of AI-native engineering.
built-with-ai.content:
Today, we executed an ambitious mission: to build the digital home for Fintricity from scratch. We used the kBuild Method to orchestrate an autonomous AI agent into a full-stack engineering team.


The Architecture of Speed

The core philosophy was Intent over Implementation. By providing the AI with a strategic blueprint, the human 'Lead Architect' could focus on vision, while the agent handled the mechanical heavy lifting.

  • Next.js 15 Foundation: We utilized the cutting-edge App Router and Server Components to ensure the site is as fast as the agents we build.
  • Data-Driven Content: Every word on this site is served from a JSON-based content layer.

cognitive-turn.title: The Cognitive Turn: Why Agency Matters in the Enterprise
cognitive-turn.author: Alpesh Doshi
cognitive-turn.description: The transition from Generative AI to Agentic AI represents the most significant structural transformation in software architecture since the cloud migration.
cognitive-turn.content:
The Macro-Structural Shift: From Generative to Agentic

The enterprise technology landscape is currently navigating a pivotal inflection point, described as the 'Cognitive Turn.' We are witnessing the end of the initial 'Generative AI' era and the dawn of the 'Agentic AI' era.

For the past three years, the market has been saturated with 'Copilots'—systems designed to assist human operators. These systems function as stateless reasoning engines. They lack the capacity to maintain state or pursue multi-step goals.



The Rise of Autonomous Agents

Fintricity is positioned to lead the next phase: the deployment of Autonomous Agents. Unlike their predecessors, these intelligent digital workers possess agency. They perceive their environment, decompose high-level business objectives into granular tasks, and orchestrate tool usage to achieve specific goals.

os-launch.author: Press Office
os-launch.description: Fintricity officially launches its core platform to address the shift from experimental 'Chat' to production-grade 'Agency.'

Key components include high-speed delivery pods and production-ready governance, providing the deterministic guardrails required for enterprise scale.

agentic-os-alpha.title: Engineering the Agentic OS: From Vision to Alpha-Stage Reliability
agentic-os-alpha.author: Alpesh Doshi
agentic-os-alpha.description: The history of our journey from vision to a self-healing, alpha-stage Agentic OS platform.
agentic-os-alpha.content:
The Shift: From Chat to Agency

On January 15th, Fintricity officially unveiled the Agentic OS—a unified communication and governance fabric designed to move enterprises beyond experimental 'chatbots' toward autonomous, reliable AI agents.


1. The Build Boundary

We leveraged the Next.js 15 Standalone Mode to ensure our production artifact was as lean as possible. By implementing a strict baseUrl in our TypeScript configuration, we bridged the gap between local speed and server-side precision.

philosophy-of-autonomy.title: The Philosophy of Autonomy: Engineering the Agentic Enterprise
philosophy-of-autonomy.author: Alpesh Doshi
philosophy-of-autonomy.description: Moving beyond AI hype toward engineering precision. Why we are building a unified nervous system for autonomous agents.
philosophy-of-autonomy.content:
Intent over Implementation

At Fintricity, we believe the next industrial revolution will be powered by orchestrating computers, not chatting with them. Our core philosophy centers on the transition from 'Linear Scripting' to 'Systems Thinking.'



Engineering Precision over AI Hype

We value deterministic outcomes over creative unpredictability. This is why we address lead architects and senior executives as peers—they understand that in a regulated enterprise, a hallucination is a liability, not a feature.

fintricity-gartner-2020.title: Fintricity in Gartner Report 2020
fintricity-gartner-2020.author: News
fintricity-gartner-2020.description: Fintricity has been featured in Gartner's Market Guide for Blockchain Consulting 2020 for the third consecutive year.
fintricity-gartner-2020.content:
Fintricity is proud to announce its inclusion in Gartner’s Market Guide for Blockchain Consulting 2020 for the third consecutive year. This achievement follows a busy and volatile year where Fintricity has been actively involved in developing projects and collaborating with various new companies on data and artificial intelligence.

Gartner, a renowned global research and advisory firm, provides crucial insights and tools for leaders across industries. Fintricity was listed among 162 blockchain consultancy and managed service providers, enabling management leaders to identify Fintricity for blockchain-related projects.

everything-has-changed.title: Everything Has Changed.
everything-has-changed.author: Alpesh Doshi
everything-has-changed.description: The accelerated pace of change due to COVID-19 and the evolving landscape of data technologies and AI adoption in enterprises.
everything-has-changed.content:
The rapidly changing times, further accelerated by COVID-19, have prompted enterprises to seriously consider their Digital Transformation. Over the past decade, there has been an early adoption of data technologies, with Artificial Intelligence (AI) generating significant hype.

Despite this, the reality of adoption shows that leveraging these technologies for company-wide transformation is still in its early stages, with less than 2% of businesses successfully deploying AI at scale. Fintricity's vision is for every enterprise to undergo Digital Transformation driven by Data.

data-lifeblood-of-brand.title: Data, The Lifeblood of a Brand?
data-lifeblood-of-brand.author: News
data-lifeblood-of-brand.description: Revisiting the critical role of data in shaping a brand, from positioning to social media engagement.
data-lifeblood-of-brand.content:
In 2013, Alpesh Doshi emphasized the transformative power of data in shaping a brand's lifecycle. He asserted that data was, and continues to be, a key asset for building brand value.

The article notes that deep learning, AI, and data science have been subjects of extensive research over the last decade, solidifying data's status as a unique and valuable enterprise asset. Data is now central to how brands interact with consumers.

webinar-behaving-digitally.title: On-Demand Webinar: Behaving Digitally
webinar-behaving-digitally.author: News
webinar-behaving-digitally.description: This webinar explores how digital behaviors in the workplace impact organizational transformation.
webinar-behaving-digitally.content:
There’s no room for complacency in the fast moving digital world. Whether it’s emerging technologies such as AI changing the shape of work, new tools such as blockchain disrupting supply chains, or robotics enhancing customers lives, digitalisation will change your organisation profoundly.

At the heart of this transformation is the need to engage your employees in behaviour change while redefining your operations and delivering value for customers.

infographic-blockchain-technology.title: [Infographic] Blockchain Technology
infographic-blockchain-technology.author: News
infographic-blockchain-technology.description: A summary of a talk by Alpesh Doshi with KPMG on blockchain technology.
infographic-blockchain-technology.content:
Alpesh Doshi recently held a talk with Fintricity’s consulting partner, KPMG. The presentation covered topics such as: What is blockchain technology? Blockchain use cases, Platform models, and Adoption of blockchain technology.

KPMG have chosen to work with Fintricity within the Asset Management space to enhance their consulting offering in providing innovative, transformational strategies and solutions, specifically around the adoption of blockchain technology within their client base.

welfare-payments-beyond-bitcoin.title: Welfare Payments Beyond Bitcoin
welfare-payments-beyond-bitcoin.author: Nemitari Ajienka
welfare-payments-beyond-bitcoin.description: Exploring the feasibility of using blockchain technology for welfare payments and the associated privacy concerns.
welfare-payments-beyond-bitcoin.content:
Bitcoin was introduced as a public participant-managed financial shared ledger network. However, central banks and Governments have come to terms with the downsides of such a decentralised model, including a lack of control over monetary policies.

One use case for blockchain technology is welfare payments. Recently, the UK’s Department of Work and Pensions (DWP) trialled the use of the blockchain to pay welfare benefits to the unemployed and disabled.

past-present-future-blockchain.title: The Past, Present and Future of Blockchain
past-present-future-blockchain.author: Estelle Roiena
past-present-future-blockchain.description: Demystifying blockchain technology and exploring its potential impact on financial services and beyond.
past-present-future-blockchain.content:
Demystifying Blockchain

Blockchain is a giant, decentralized, shared, replicated, synchronized, and distributed database that securely records immutable electronic transactions. Transactions are chronologically entered, shared, replicated, and secured by cryptographic sealing, making them difficult to falsify.
